content.title: Overview
content.scenario: Some students want to grow a garden. The garden will be in their schoolyard. The garden will have plants. It will also have earthworms! Your job is to make a model garden.

tabs.title: Developing and Using Models
tabs.descripion:
Scientists use models. Models help them learn. Models help them ask and answer questions.

You will build a model garden. The model will have plants. It will have earthworms. The model will help you learn.

You will change the model. This will help you learn more.

tabs.title: Experiment and Control Support
tabs.descripion:
Think about what living things need.

What do plants need to live?

What do animals need to live?

What if the needs are not met?

Think about how much water the plants and earthworms will need.

What might happen if they get too much water?

What might happen if they get too little water?

descripion.paragraph:
Earthworms and plants help each other.

Some earthworms live in garden soil. They eat dead leaves. They also eat tiny plant parts.

Earthworms get water from soil. They make paths in soil when they move. This helps plants get the water they need.

Earthworms add things to the soil when they poop! These things help plants grow.

Plants help earthworms by giving them food.
